channel.title: Creating a mouse?
channel.description:
I've tried a couple different ways on how to make a 'new' instance of mouse within an applet in order for it to be independently controlled, each idea has more or less not gone how I planned.
I couldn't find any libraries pertaining to this, I've asked StackOver, now I come to you. I don't necessarily want code, just a solid idea that has been proven to work. This does pertain to Runescape, but I don't want the mouse to be dependent on the client itself.

item.title: Creating a mouse?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

there is your problem, that event is caused when the mouse is clicked (even a generated one), so take it out of there and call it from your program. Make a test button to call the function with a random x, y offset to see if it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a mouse?
item.dc:creator: @zbubblez zbubblez
item.description:
@zbubblez wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:27, topic:426039”]where are you adding the code? it sounds like you are creating an infinite loop by recursively calling click[/quote]I just have it within the he MousePressed action of the mouseListener

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a mouse?
item.dc:creator: @zbubblez zbubblez
item.description:
@zbubblez wrote:

Ollie:

The client is probably out of date due to jagex constantly updating and you will have to take the logic from the code and plug it into your loader. If you haven’t got time to find out why it is broken I can do it on monday.

It is in my loader, I got it to click, but it clicks like 6-8 times… Im adding it to the canvas which im using rsApp.getComponentAt(0,0); to get.

item.title: Creating a mouse?
item.dc:creator: @Fsig Fsig
item.description:
@Fsig wrote:

Ok I have tried your code again, and I used your ‘TestAccessorMethods’ with being sent the applet.

After that I created a new mouse by going…
‘Mouse m = new Mouse(tam)’; (tam = the accessor method.)

Now I have tried to call ‘m.clickMouse(new Point(347,263), MouseV.LEFT_BUTTON);’ which should click in the password field.
And it does not.

Have I got a issue understanding your AccessorMethods?

Read full topic

[code]MouseEvent me = new MouseEvent(XYZ.getApplet().getComponent(0),
MouseEvent.MOUSE_CLICKED,
System.currentTimeMillis(),
0,
300,226,
1,
false);

		XYZ.getApplet().getComponent(0).dispatchEvent(me);[/code]

item.title: Creating a mouse?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:5, topic:426039”]applet.getComponent(0).dispatchEvent[/quote]Exactly this. Think of the applet as exactly what it is, a component which like other components reacts to the events which act on it. You can dispatch events to it through the function Ollie posted here, as if the user were doing it. Events to send include MouseEvent and KeyEvent.

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/awt/Component.html#dispatchEvent(java.awt.AWTEvent)
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/awt/event/MouseEvent.html
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/awt/event/KeyEvent.html

Read full topic
